sense.definition: (above and across) vertically above and moving/extending (at least partially) across X2 (e.g., flew over the plains)
(above) vertically above (e.g., the halo over his head)

expressing passage or trajectory across (but without implied vertical separation); expressing a location that could be reached by travel across (e.g., journey over the desert, the house over the hill)
located at the other side of
across so as to form a covering (e.g., spread jam over it)
expressing the means by which something is done (e.g., talk over the phone)
by means of the resistant surface constituted by (an object), as with striking or hitting (e.g., broke his club over Joe's head)
in cases of perceived despite some sort of interference, usually some sort of audible noise (e.g., heard it over the rock music)
indicating the subject of (and, sometimes, the reason for) (e.g., fought over the trophy)
indicating a time period during which something happens or persists (e.g., the food spoiled over the weekend)
expressing dominance or influence, as of authority, rank, or victory (e.g. power over him)
indicating some foodstuff available/consumed during an event/activity (e.g., discuss it over coffee)
sense.notes: only examples that fit here were labeled 14(5) in TPP, but 14(5) is defined for temporal extent
